result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance M Perrodin

defendant.name: Perrodin, Lance M
defendant.address: N4870 Little Creek Road, Brantwood, WI 54513

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on December 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

8:31 AM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Lance M Perrodin appeared by video.  Attorney Christopher Wilhelm appeared by video for Lance M Perrodin.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Parties discuss dates for a Motion Hearing. DA Kelz gives a date of 12/14/22 at 3:30 PM.
Letter to Judge Requesting Zoom Appearance 9-19-22
Ltr to Judge re Def Appearance
Waiver of Personal Appearance
Arraignment on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:00 AM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Lance M Perrodin in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christopher Wilhelm in court for Lance M Perrodin. DA Kelz calls witness Kristina Trimble an investigator with the Price County Sheriff's Department. Witness sworn. Direct questioning by DA Kelz. Witness identifies the defendant on record. Cross examination by Attorney Wilhelm. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. Attorney Wilhelm requests arraignment be scheduled at a later date in order to allow time to go over the information filed by the State. Court makes comments and advises Attorney Wilhelm to contact the Judicial Assistant to schedule next hearing. Adj 10:13 AM
Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduled for 04/05/2022 at 2:45 PM
Defendant's current information

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): R.J.E.  unless a written waiver is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office or The Price County Sheriff's Office outside of normal business hours. 
*No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

10:30 AM Defendant Lance M Perrodin appeared with attorney Christopher Wilhelm via telephone.  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. Bond ordered as requested.
Demand for Specific Discovery
For Discovery
Motion to Preserve Evidence
Request to appear remotely

Payable Number: 61507,
Receipt Number: 22R 000593,
Amount: $20.00
State's demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA evidence

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): R.J.E
*No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances
Defendant may NOT leave the State of Wisconsin without permission from the court

2:26 PM ADA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant appeared via video from the Price County Jail. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for The State of Wisconsin. DE next court date is 03/01/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Court questions defendant on tie to Price Co. Defendant gives responses. Signature bond set as requested.
